title: Ticket #3563: Schedd commands to audit
description:
We want the audit log for HTCondor-CE to include entries for all commands to the schedd coming from users. For all of these commands, we will record basic security information (source IP address, authenticated identity, HTCondor identity, command name). This information will be written by DaemonCore before the command callout to the schedd code. For most commands, we will record additional information specific to that command. For example, the ids of any submitted jobs. This information will be written from the relevant schedd functions.

This ticket will track what commands should be logged at all and what command-specific information should be included. Some commands are received from both users and trusted daemons. When these commands are received from a trusted daemon, then no logging is required.

You can write to the audit log by calling audit_log(). It works like dprintf(), but the first argument is a ReliSock* instead of a debug category.

The Commands

Here are all of the READ, WRITE and DAEMON level commands registered by the schedd, ignoring commands registered in DaemonCore for all daemons. These are the commands we may want to log.

When we say that the expected client is the "job owner", this could be a user running a command-line tool, the condor_c-gahp, or the Job Router. In any of these cases, the client will authenticate as the job owner, not as a Condor daemon.

DAEMON Level Commands

DAEMON and WRITE levels are mostly synonymous. Many configurations may allow users to issue DAEMON level commands

  • GIVE_MATCHES
    • Expected clients: shadow
    • Don't log

WRITE Level Commands

WRITE level commands are the ones we're most interested in, as they modify state.

  • TRANSFER_QUEUE_REQUEST
    • Expected clients: shadow
    • Don't log

  • RESCHEDULE
    • Expected clients: job owner, site admin
    • Don't log

  • ACT_ON_JOBS
    • Expected clients: job owner, site admin
    • Log
    • Extra information: command (rm, rm -rf, hold, release, vacate, vacate fast, suspend, continue), job id list or constraint

  • SPOOL_JOB_FILES
    • Expected clients: job owner
    • Log
    • Extra information: job ids, job proxy info (if transferred)

  • SPOOL_JOB_FILES_WITH_PERMS
    • Expected clients: job owner
    • Log
    • Extra information: job ids, job proxy info (if transferred)

  • TRANSFER_DATA
    • Expected clients: job owner
    • Log
    • Extra information: job ids

  • TRANSFER_DATA_WITH_PERMS
    • Expected clients: job owner
    • Log
    • Extra information: job ids

  • UPDATE_GSI_CRED
    • Expected clients: job owner
    • Log
    • Extra information: job id, job proxy info

  • DELEGATE_GSI_CRED_SCHEDD
    • Expected clients: job owner
    • Log
    • Extra information: job id, job proxy info

  • REQUEST_SANDBOX_LOCATION
    • Expected clients: job owner
    • Don't log
    • Extra information: job id

  • RECYCLE_SHADOW
    • Expected clients: shadow
    • Don't log

  • ATTEMPT_ACCESS
    • Expected clients: job owner
    • Don't log
    • Extra information: read/write, file path

  • STORE_CRED
    • Expected clients: job owner
    • Windows only
    • Don't log

  • QMGMT_WRITE_CMD
    • Expected clients: job owner, shadow, gridmanager, site admin
    • Log
    • Extra information:
      • CONDOR_NewCluster: Clusterids of submitted jobs
      • CONDOR_SetAttribute*: job id, attribute name, and attribute value for changes to existing jobs

  • GET_MYPROXY_PASSWORD
    • Expected clients: gridmanager
    • Don't log

  • GET_JOB_CONNECT_INFO
    • Expected clients: job owner
    • Log
    • Extra information: job id

  • CLEAR_DIRTY_JOB_ATTRS
    • Expected clients: shadow, gridmanager
    • Don't log

READ Level Commands

For the most part, READ level commands are not interesting, but some may be of concern.

  • RELEASE_CLAIM
    • Expected clients: startd
    • Valid claimid must be presented
    • Don't log

  • ALIVE
    • Expected clients: startd
    • Valid claimid must be presented
    • Don't log

  • QUERY_SCHEDD_ADS
    • Expected clients: job owner, site admin
    • Don't log

  • QUERY_SUBMITTOR_ADS
    • Expected clients: job owner, site admin
    • Don't log

  • QMGMT_READ_CMD
    • Expected clients: job owner, site admin
    • Don't log

  • DUMP_STATE
    • Expected clients: site admin
    • Tool condor_squawk only on Windows
    • Don't log
